L2_gloss: The fifty-second and the last letter of the Malayalam in Arabic script. It represents the Malayalam letter ഴ.
The 42nd letter of the Malayalam in the Arabic script. It represents the Malayalam letter ര. The Arabic script is rarely used to write Malayalam.
The 27th letter of the Malayalam Arabic script. It represents the Malayalam letter ഡ.
The 45th letter of the Malayalam Arabic script. It represents the Malayalam letter ഴ. The Arabic script is rarely used to write Malayalam.
The twenty-ninth letter of the Malayalam in Arabic script. It represents the Malayalam letter ണ.
The twenty-fourth letter of the Malayalam in Arabic script. It represents the Malayalam letter ഞ.
The forty-eighth letter of the Malayalam in Arabic script. It represents the Malayalam letter ഷ.
The forty-sixth letter of the Malayalam in Arabic script. It represents the Malayalam letter ള. The Arabic script is rarely used to write Malayalam.
The nineteenth letter of the Malayalam in Arabic script. It represents the Malayalam letter ങ.
The combining form of the vowel അം (aṃ), anusvara.
The 1st letter of Malayalam alphabet. Transliterated as a.
A vowel letter of Malayalam alphabet. Transliterated as aṃ.
A vowel letter for the visarga in the Malayalam abugida. Transliterated as aḥ.
The second letter of Malayalam alphabet. Transliterated
The short vowel "i", in its independent form.
The 4th letter of Malayalam alphabet. Transliterated
The short vowel "u", in its independent form. Transliterated as u.
shallot; a smaller species of onion.
The 6th letter of Malayalam alphabet. Transliterated as ū.
meals, Kerala thali, rice meals, usually eaten at noon,
The 7th letter of the Malayalam alphabet. There used to be a longer form of it ൠ (which is now obsolete). Transliterated as r̥.
The 8th letter of Malayalam alphabet. Transliterated as e.
The 9th letter of Malayalam alphabet. Transliterated as ē.
The 11th letter of Malayalam alphabet. Transliterated as o.
The 12th letter of Malayalam alphabet. Transliterated as ō.
Onam, a harvest festival celebrated in Kerala, India.,
orange (both the fruit and the color)
The 13th letter of Malayalam alphabet. Transliterated as au.
The 15th letter of Malayalam alphabet, called ക (ka). Transliterated as k.
a long piece of metal, metal wire, cord, thread
coir, thick rope (made of coir, plastic, etc.)
leg, a lower limb of of humans, a leg (supportive and
The residence of a king, a palace or the inner part of a palace.
The 16th letter of Malayalam alphabet, called ഖ (kha). Transliterated as kh.
The 17th letter of Malayalam alphabet, called ഗ (ga). Transliterated as g.
The 18th letter of Malayalam alphabet, called ഘ (gha). Transliterated as gh.
The 19th letter of Malayalam alphabet, called ങ (ṅa). Transliterated as ṅ.

spider (eight legged predatory arthropod)
Synonym: എട്ടുകാലി (eṭṭukāli)
cough, noisy expulsion of air from lungs, as a symptom
The 21st letter of Malayalam alphabet, called ഛ (cha). Transliterated as ch.

vomit, puke
Coordinate terms: ചുമ (cuma), മൂക്കൊലിപ്പ് (mūkkolippŭ), പനി (pani), വയറിളക്കം (vayaṟiḷakkaṃ)
The 22nd letter of Malayalam alphabet, called ജ (ja). Transliterated as j.
The 23rd letter of Malayalam alphabet, called ഝ (jha). Transliterated as jh.
The 24th letter of Malayalam alphabet, called ഞ (ña). Transliterated as ñ.
The 25th letter of Malayalam abugida. Transliterated as ṭ.
The 26th letter of Malayalam abugida. Transliterated as ṭh.
The 27th letter of Malayalam alphabet, called ഡ (ḍa). Transliterated as ḍ.
The 28th letter of Malayalam alphabet, called ഢ (ḍha). Transliterated as ḍh.
The 29th letter of Malayalam alphabet, called ണ (ṇa). Transliterated as ṇ.
The 30th letter of Malayalam alphabet, called ത (ta). Transliterated as t.
feed, animal feed, food for animals and pets, Synonym:
honey bee, insect that collects honey, Synonyms: ഇണ്ട
The 31st letter of Malayalam alphabet, called ഥ (tha). Transliterated as th.
The 32nd letter of Malayalam alphabet, called ദ (da). Transliterated as d.
The 33rd letter of Malayalam alphabet, called ധ (dha). Transliterated as dh.

The 34th letter of Malayalam alphabet, called ന (na). Historically there was another character to represent just the apical alveolar nasal (ഩ (ṉa)) and ന just for the dental one, nowadays it has become obsolete and ന represents both of them. Transliterated as n.
green colour, raw, uncooked, unripe, tattoo: പച്ചകുത്തുക
green coloured, tender, unripe, raw, uncooked, unadulterated,
dust, powder, little, small piece, particle, particulate
powdery, powdered, grounded, dusty, little, small
The 36th letter of Malayalam abugida. Transliterated as either ph or f. Nowadays more commonly pronounced as [f] especially by youngsters.
The 37th letter of Malayalam abugida. Transliterated as b.
The 38th letter of Malayalam abugida. Transliterated as bh.
food, Synonym: ആഹാരം (āhāraṃ), Coordinate term: പാചകം
The 39th letter of Malayalam alphabet, called മ (ma). Transliterated as m.
The 40th letter of Malayalam abugida. Transliterated as y.
The 41th letter of Malayalam abugida. Transliterated as r.
The 42th letter of Malayalam abugida. Transliterated as ṟ.
to cancel, to cancel a show or program
The 43rd letter of Malayalam alphabet, called ല (la). Transliterated as l.
target, intention, goal, aim, Synonyms: ഉന്നം (unnaṃ),
The 51th letter of Malayalam abugida. Transliterated as ḷ.
The 45th letter of the Malayalam alphabet, called ഴ (ḻa). Transliterated as ḻ.
The 46th letter of Malayalam alphabet, called വ (va). Transliterated as v.
elderly man, old man, Synonyms: വയോധികന്‍ (vayōdhikan‍),
year, Synonym: കൊല്ലം (kollaṃ), rain, Synonym: മഴ (maḻa),
The 47th letter of Malayalam alphabet, called ശ (śa). Transliterated as ś.
attention, mind's focus, focus of mind, care, watchful
The 48th letter of Malayalam alphabet, called ഷ (ṣa). Transliterated as ṣ.
The 49th letter of Malayalam alphabet, called സ (sa). Transliterated as s.
to speak, to talk, verbal communication
The 50th letter of Malayalam alphabet, called ഹ (ha). Transliterated as h.
comedy, humour, joke, Synonyms: തമാശ (tamāśa), നർമ്മം

(archaic) This letter in the Malayalam abugida represents a voiceless unaspirated apical alveolar stop while ത represents a laminal dental stop. This letter is archaic and is not included in the current orthography, in the modern orthography it is written with a റ below another റ ⟨റ്റ⟩. Transliterated as ṯ.
The combining form of the long vowel ആ (ā).
The combining form of the short vowel & (ഇ, “i”).
The combining form of the long vowel ഈ (ī, “ī”).
The combining form of the short vowel ഉ (u, “u”).
The combining form of the long vowel ഊ (ū).
The combining form of the short vowel ഋ (ṛ).
The combining form of the long vowel ൠ (ṝ).
The combining form of the short vowel എ (e).
The combining form of the long vowel ഏ (ē).
The combining form of the short vowel ഐ (ai).
The combining form of the short vowel ഒ (o).
The combining form of the long vowel ഓ (ō, “ō”).
(archaic) The combining form of the short vowel ഔ (au).
ചന്ദ്രക്കല (candrakkala). Malayalam diacritic for virama; it is used to signify the lack of an inherent vowel.

In the traditional orthography, a dead consonant r before a consonant sometimes takes an above-base form, known as a dot reph, which looks like a short vertical line or a dot. Generally, a chillu-r (ർ) is used instead of a dot reph in the reformed orthography.[1]
The combining form of the short vowel ഔ (au).

This obsolete character used to be the 8th letter of the Malayalam abugida which represented the longer form of the letter ഋ. Removed from the orthography in the 1971 spelling reform. Transliterated as r̥̄.

This obsolete character used to be the 10th letter of the Malayalam abugida which represented the longer form of the letter ഌ (also obsolete). Removed from the orthography in the 1971 spelling reform. Transliterated as l̥̄.

A Malayalam chillu letter (ചില്ലക്ഷരം). It represents the consonant letter ണ (ṇa) with a cancelled root vowel. Transliterated as ṇ.
This letter, like other chillus, never occurs as the first letter of any Malayalam word.

A Malayalam chillaksharam (ചില്ലക്ഷരം) that represents the  consonant letter ന (na) with a cancelled root vowel.  Transliterated as n.
This letter, like other chillus, never occurs as the first letter of any Malayalam word.
